text:
benchmarking an ssl server with
> ab -n 100 -c 20 -t 10 -s https://hostname/
causes the following error:

Application Error : The instruction at "0x004027a6" referenced memory 
at "0x00000011". The memory could not be "read".
creator: michael.straessle@bk.admin.ch
towerofpower@operamail.com
text:
Try setting loglevel in httpd.conf to above 'warn'.  This sounds a lot like 
another error.  That was the solution to that error.

The application error doesn't show in apache, but in ab (ApacheBench Version 
2.0.40-dev <$Revision: 1.121.2.1 $>, included in the 2.0.45 distribution).
Target server logs show that a first 'round' (concurrent hits as specified with 
the -c switch) is executed before the crash.

Changing apache loglevel doesn't influence this scenario.
creator: michael.straessle@bk.admin.ch

text:
One hint (I see these often) if you have mixed a 'debug' build of OpenSSL
  with a 'release' build of ab.exe, or visa versa.  Please make certain you
  are using the same compiler, debug options etc between your OpenSSL and your
  ab.exe build.  (That would probably include an 'nmake clean' at this point.)

  Note that the distributed ab.exe doesn't support ssl, any more than we
  distribute mod_ssl at this point, due to distribution U.S. export policy 
  concerns.  I am going to guess you have the distributed non-ssl flavor of
  ab.exe, so I'm closing as invalid.  If this is the ssl flavor you have built
  yourself, please reopen if the same 'release' or 'debug' code between OpenSSL
  and ab.exe doesn't solve your problem.

  Note also that ab builds the non-ssl flavor, and a special package, 'abs.dps'
  builds the ssl flavor.  The makefile.win decides if abs.dsp can be used, and
  copies that binary as 'ab.exe' into your target tree when openssl exists.
creator: wrowe@apache.org
michael.straessle@bk.admin.ch

text:
Crashes on HTTPd 2.1 CVS HEAD on FreeBSD-current.

Only seems to happen when connecting to an SSL based webserver.

command: ab -n 1000 -c 10 https://localhost/

backtrace:
#0  test () at ab.c:1728
#1  0x0804ea7c in main (argc=6, argv=0xbfbffb34) at ab.c:2235
#2  0x0804a669 in _start ()
creator: chip@cyan.com
jorton@redhat.com
text:
The "it really doesn't work" stuff was fixed on the trunk a while back; it does
work a little bit now, if you've got the wind in the right direction.

http://svn.apache.org/viewcvs.cgi?rev=102014&view=rev
any chance this fix will be backported to 2.0.x branch in the near future?
creator: michael.straessle@bk.admin.ch
